title: Create Universal QUICKREF.md Standard
description: Design and deploy scannable 1-2 page reference guide (QUICKREF.md) to all 8 projects, reducing human onboarding time by 50% (30 min → 15 min) and agent context gathering by 50% (10 min → 5 min).
goal: Eliminate documentation discovery friction by providing instant access to essential commands, project structure, common tasks, and quick troubleshooting fixes.
requirements: Template must be 150-250 lines (scannable in 2-3 minutes)
Sections: Essential Commands, Project Structure, Common Tasks, Troubleshooting Quick-Fixes
Generated for all 8 projects (coderef-docs, assistant, coderef-system, coderef-dashboard, papertrail, coderef-testing, coderef-personas, coderef-context)
constraints: Must not duplicate README.md content (complement, not replace)
Must be auto-updatable (track essential commands from code)
Must follow consistent format across all projects

qualitative.scannable: Users can find any command in < 30 seconds

deliverables.name: QUICKREF-TEMPLATE.md
deliverables.description: Universal template with placeholders for project-specific content
deliverables.format: Markdown with sections and code blocks

deliverables.name: CI/CD Validation Script
deliverables.description: Check QUICKREF.md exists and has required sections

implementation_phases.name: Template Creation
tasks: TASK-001: Research existing QUICKREF examples (GitHub, open source projects)
TASK-002: Design 4-section structure (Commands, Structure, Tasks, Troubleshooting)
TASK-004: Review template with 2+ team members

implementation_phases.name: Reference Implementation
tasks: TASK-005: Generate QUICKREF.md for papertrail (reference project)
TASK-006: Test with 1 new user, measure onboarding time
TASK-007: Iterate template based on feedback

implementation_phases.name: Validation & Measurement
tasks: TASK-015: Create CI/CD validation script (check sections present)
TASK-016: Test with 3 new users across 3 projects
TASK-017: Measure onboarding time (baseline vs new)

integration.description: Validate QUICKREF.md links from README.md work correctly

user_acceptance.description: 3 new users test onboarding with QUICKREF, measure time and satisfaction

risks.risk: Template too generic, doesn't fit all project types
risks.mitigation: Create reference implementations for different project types (MCP server, CLI tool, library) before full rollout

risks.risk: Content becomes stale as projects evolve
risks.mitigation: Add CI/CD check that fails if QUICKREF.md not updated in >90 days with code changes
Clearly differentiate: README = comprehensive guide, QUICKREF = 5-minute reference. Promote QUICKREF as fast entry point.

requested_by: coderef-docs: 'Need quick command reference - no 1-2 page scannable guide'
coderef-dashboard: 'Developers have to read 732-line CLAUDE.md to find commands'
coderef-system: 'No quick-start tutorial - jumps straight to deep content'
coderef-testing: 'README explains project but no your first test in 60 seconds tutorial'
coderef-personas: 'No quick-start examples for persona activation'
papertrail: 'No Common Use Cases quick reference in README'

external: README.md must exist and link to QUICKREF.md
Essential commands must be documented somewhere (code comments, CLAUDE.md)

related_workorders: WO-CLAUDEMD-STANDARDIZATION-001 (CLAUDE.md provides deep dive, QUICKREF provides quick reference)
